## Summary

**R** is a so-called multiparadigm language. It supports different programming styles and different kinds of object-orientation. That's why the same things can be done with basically different approaches. It can sometimes be confusing at the first look. But the good news is, that **R** was open to modern developments that make data analysis much easier and straifgtforward whithout loosing the power of the original language.

The introduction will demonstrate selected examples with base **R** and **tidyverse**.
